greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of nonzero terms in the expansion of (x-y) * (x^2-y^2) * (x^3-y^3) * ... * (x^n-y^n).
comment: In the definition one can take y=1. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 01 2008
link: Joerg Arndt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Dorin Andrica, Ovidiu Bagdasar, On some results concerning the polygonal polynomials, Carpathian Journal of Mathematics (2019) Vol. 35, No. 1, 1-11.
maple: a:=proc(n) options operator, arrow: nops(expand(product(x^j-y^j,j=1..n))) end proc: seq(a(n),n=0..50); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 01 2008
results.author: Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Aug 03 2003
ext: a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 12 2017
